bibdata.title: Refactor bibliographic/:id/availability to use fewer alma API calls for CDL information

comments.body:
Neither the Bib API or the Holding API gives us the information that we need to determine if a record is available via CDL. We need to drill down to the Items API to get information about work orders (which is where CDL is indicated). 

With the current implementation we always make the Bib API call. We only make the additional items API call if the item is unavailable. I believe this is as good as it gets.

Some background information:

The Bib API (https://api-na.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/almaws/v1/bibs/9965126093506421?format=json&apikey=your-key) returns something like this:

```
{
  "mms_id": "9965126093506421",
  "record_format": "marc21",
  "linked_record_id": {
    "value": null,
    "type": null
  },
  "title": "Beautiful passing lives : poems /",
  "author": "Harkness, Edward.",
  "issn": null,
  "isbn": "1929355734 (pbk.)",
  "network_number": [
    "(NjP)6512609-princetondb",
    "6512609",
    "(OCoLC)700510448",
    "(OCoLC)ocn700510448"
  ],
  "place_of_publication": "New York, NY :",
  "date_of_publication": "c2010.",
  "publisher_const": "Pleasure Boat Studios,",
  "holdings": {
    "value": null,
    "link": "https://api-na.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/almaws/v1/bibs/9965126093506421/holdings"
  },
  "created_by": "import",
  "created_date": "2020-12-02Z",
  "suppress_from_publishing": "false",
  "suppress_from_external_search": "false",
  "sync_with_oclc": "BIBS",
  "sync_with_libraries_australia": "NONE",
  "originating_system": "ILS",
  "originating_system_id": "6512609-princetondb",
  "anies": [XML-CONTENT-GOES-HERE]"
  ],
  "requests": {
    "value": 1,
    "link": "https://api-na.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/almaws/v1/bibs/9965126093506421/requests"
  },
  "link": null
}
```

The XML in the `anies` fiels has the holding information in the AVA datafield:

```
<datafield ind1=" " ind2=" " tag="AVA">
        <subfield code="0">9965126093506421</subfield>
        <subfield code="8">22202918790006421</subfield>
        <subfield code="a">01PRI_INST</subfield>
        <subfield code="b">firestone</subfield>
        <subfield code="c">Stacks</subfield>
        <subfield code="d">PS3558.A62424 B43 2010</subfield>
        <subfield code="e">unavailable</subfield>
        <subfield code="f">1</subfield>
        <subfield code="g">1</subfield>
        <subfield code="j">stacks</subfield>
        <subfield code="k">0</subfield>
        <subfield code="p">1</subfield>
        <subfield code="q">Firestone Library</subfield>
    </datafield>
```
Notice that there is no work order here.

The Holdings API call (https://api-na.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/almaws/v1/bibs/9965126093506421/holdings?format=json&apikey=your-key) gives the following information:

```
{
    "holding": [
        {
            "holding_id": "22202918790006421",
            "library": {
                "value": "firestone",
                "desc": "Firestone Library"
            },
            "location": {
                "value": "stacks",
                "desc": "stacks: Firestone Library"
            },
            "call_number": "PS3558.A62424 B43 2010",
            "suppress_from_publishing": "false",
            "link": "https://api-na.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/almaws/v1/bibs/9965126093506421/holdings/22202918790006421"
        }
    ],
    "bib_data": {
        "title": "Beautiful passing lives : poems /",
        "author": "Harkness, Edward.",
        "isbn": "1929355734 (pbk.)",
        "publisher": "Pleasure Boat Studios,",
        "mms_id": "9965126093506421",
        "issn": null,
        "network_number": [
            "(NjP)6512609-princetondb",
            "6512609",
            "(OCoLC)700510448",
            "(OCoLC)ocn700510448"
        ],
        "place_of_publication": "New York, NY :",
        "date_of_publication": "c2010.",
        "link": "https://api-na.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/almaws/v1/bibs/9965126093506421"
    },
    "total_record_count": 1
}
```

Again, notice that there is no work order information here.
Thank you for double-checking @hectorcorrea

ActiveStorage w/ S3 works well. We use it in Pulmap.

bibdata.title: Provide a way for figgy to check for updated bib records

comments.body: Figgy needs to be able to request a list of updated bib. records. Does Figgy transmit one request per record, or is there a batch of requests?
This may not be a high priority feature, as the metadata refresh feature in Figgy has been down or broken, and it was not necessary to repair this immediately.
One may also be able to use a Solr field in order to determine which fields within the Document have been changed, so this might only require a small number of requests.

bibdata.title: Index deletions failing from timeout errors
Update orangetheses in the alma branch

comments.body:
@kayiwa could describe better the upgrade process. 
From slack: We ran the update to postgres 13 on April 22nd, but it was still connecting to 12 since April 22. Today the app was erroring because of the 13 upgrade. @kayiwa ran the playbook and the tables were all back in place in postgres 13 cluster, however no data exist in the tables.
I copied locally the file entire_database.sql and per @kayiwa advice I will try to load it locally for alma-staging and see if I can populate at least the schema migration table.

this was fixed by:
ssh pulsys@lib-postgres-staging1
sudo su postgres
psql
drop database thenameofOLstagingdatabase
finally deploy again

4: <%= PhysicalHoldingsMarkupBuilder.restrictions_markup(holding_requests_adapter.restrictions) %> app/services/online_holdings_markup_builder.rb:113:in `block in electronic_portfolio_markup' app/services/online_holdings_markup_builder.rb:108:in `each' app/services/online_holdings_markup_builder.rb:108:in `electronic_portfolio_markup' app/services/online_holdings_markup_builder.rb:152:in `online_holdings' app/services/online_holdings_markup_builder.rb:161:in `online_holdings_block' app/services/online_holdings_markup_builder.rb:131:in `build' app/services/holding_requests_builder.rb:41:in `build' app/helpers/application_helper.rb:102:in `holding_request_block' app/views/catalog/_show_restrictions.html.erb:1:in `_app_views_catalog__show_restrictions_html_erb__253768953027409439_70072674902700' app/views/catalog/show.html.erb:5:in `_app_views_catalog_show_html_erb__1154356256282703820_70072674420820' lib/orangelight/middleware/invalid_parameter_handler.rb:12:in `call'`

orangetheses.title: Update library name and location to Mudd Manuscript Library

comments.body:
I'm creating a new theses json file locally to reindex the 3 examples in alma-qa.
https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/?f%5Bformat%5D%5B%5D=Senior+thesis&f%5Blocation%5D%5B%5D=Seeley+G.+Mudd+Library+%28Mudd%29&q=id%3Adsp*&search_field=all_fields

I reindexed the three examples and my understanding is that both location and library should be Mudd Manuscript library. When I changed location to Stacks and reindexed, it created in the library facet a 'Stacks' Library.  https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog?utf8=%E2%9C%93&search_field=all_fields&q=id%3Adsp* 

I will update the PR.

![Screen Shot 2021-06-04 at 10 38 03 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/120818826-f8e03280-c520-11eb-8028-b0325b0ca3f3.png)
I updated the PR to use `Mudd Manuscript library` both for location and library.

requests.title: SCSB In library Use record is not acting the same
Adding a Alma hold request for Princeton owned ReCap items
Create Alma Hold Request for PUL Owned Items in ReCAP

comments.body:
I think we want to order the two requests like this:

1, Place a SCSB Physical Item Request for the item in question
2. If that is successful, place an Alma hold request for the same item. These requests should be identical to the hold requests in #933.
